sen.j: 杣街道（そまかいどう）は、江戸時代に滋賀県（近江国）甲賀郡に存在した街道。
sen.e: Soma-kaido Highway was a highway that existed in the Edo period between Shiga prefecture (Oumi Provicen) and Koka-gun county.
Soma-kaido Highway was a highway that existed in the Edo period between Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province) and Koka County.
sen.cmt: Prefecture大文字にしました。Omi Provinceスペル訂正しました。Koka Countyに訂正しました。
sen.e: Soma-kaido Highway was a highway that existed in the Edo period between Shiga Prefecture (Omi Province) and Koka County.
It was also called Sokai-do Road and Shin Kai-do Road.
It was also called Somakai-do Road and Shinkai-do Road.
It was also called Somakai-do Road and Shinkai-do Road.

tit.cmt: ピリオド削除しました。

sen.j: 杣川沿いのこのルートは近江朝時代の東海道で「倉歴（くらぶ）道」ともいう。
sen.e: This route along Soma River was the equivalent of Tokai-do Road (route connecting Nara and Kanto area) during the Omicho period and was also called Kurabu-do Road.
This route along Soma-gawa River was the equivalent of Tokai-do Road (route connecting Nara and Kanto area) during the Omi Court period and was also called 'Kurabu-do Road.'
sen.cmt: Soma-gawaに訂正しました。Omi Courtに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: This route along Soma-gawa River was the equivalent of Tokai-do Road (route connecting Nara and Kanto area) during the Omi Court period and was also called 'Kurabu-do Road.'

sen.j: 壬申の乱後に一旦廃れたが、平安時代にも886年（仁和2年）に鈴鹿峠経由で関に至る「阿須波（あすは）越」に変更されるまで東海道として利用された。
sen.e: It was destroyed after the Jinshinno-ran Uprising but used as Tokai-do Road until the route was changed to go over Asuha via Suzuka Pass in 886 during the Heian period.
It was destroyed after the Jinshin Uprising but used as Tokai-do Road until the route was changed to 'go over Asuha' via Suzuka Pass in 886 during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: Jinshin Uprisingに訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: It was destroyed after the Jinshin Uprising but used as Tokai-do Road until the route was changed to 'go over Asuha' via Suzuka Pass in 886 during the Heian period.

sen.j: その後も、湖南から伊賀に抜ける「伊賀道」として、伊勢参宮の間道として、山伏の道として、杣谷の人々にとっての主要道として重要な道であった。
sen.e: The route continued to be important for the people of Soya as the Iga Road from Konan to Iga, as the route for pilgrimage to Ise Shrine, and as the road for Yamabushi (mountain priets).

The route continued to be important for the people of Soma-dani Valley as the 'Iga-michi Road' from Konan to Iga, as the route for pilgrimage to Ise Shrine, and as the road for Yamabushi (mountain priests).
sen.cmt: priestsスペル訂正しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。Iga-michi Road に訂正しました。杣谷→Soma-dani Valley
sen.e: The route continued to be important for the people of Soma-dani Valley as the 'Iga-michi Road' from Konan to Iga, as the route for pilgrimage to Ise Shrine, and as the road for Yamabushi (mountain priests).

sen.j: 江戸時代に入って17世紀には三雲から東海道と分れて伊賀へ至る現在のルートの大要が確認でき、1742年（寛保2年）の資料には「杣海道」の名称が確認できる。
sen.e: In the 17th century, in the Edo period, most of the current route that separates from Tokaido Road at Mikumo and stretches to Iga seems to have been established and in a 1742 document, there is a reference to Somakai-do Highway.

In the 17th century, in the Edo period, most of the current route that separates from Tokai-do Road at Mikumo and stretches to Iga seems to have been established and in a 1742 document, there is a reference to 'Somakai-do Highway.'
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。原文の「」に合せて'を補足しました。
sen.e: In the 17th century, in the Edo period, most of the current route that separates from Tokai-do Road at Mikumo and stretches to Iga seems to have been established and in a 1742 document, there is a reference to 'Somakai-do Highway.'

sen.j: 現在のルートが整えられたのは明治20年代のことで、当時これを「新海道」と称した。
sen.e: The current route was serviced around xxxx and it was called Shinkai-do Road at the time.
The current route was serviced around 1887 and it was called Shinkai-do Road at the time.
sen.cmt: 明治20年代訳漏れ。補足しました。
sen.e: The current route was serviced around 1887 and it was called Shinkai-do Road at the time.
Kansai Railway was built along the route in 1889.
Kansai Railway was built along the route in 1889.
Kansai Railway was built along the route in 1889.

sen.j: 1907年に国有化され、現在のJR草津線となっている。
sen.e: It was nationalized in 1907 and is now the JR Kusatsu Line.
It was nationalized in 1907 and is now the JR Kusatsu Line.
It was nationalized in 1907 and is now the JR Kusatsu Line.

sen.j: 三雲（湖南市） → 三本柳（甲賀市水口町） → 深川市場（甲賀市甲南町） → 寺庄（甲賀市甲南町） → 大原市場（甲賀市甲賀町） → 上野（甲賀市甲賀町） → 柘植（三重県伊賀市柘植町）＜大和街道に合流＞ → 加太市場（亀山市） → 関（亀山市関町）
sen.e: Mikumo (Konan City) --> Sanbonyanagi (Minakuchi, Koka City) -->Fukagawa Market (Konanncho, Koka City) --> Terasho (Konancho, Koka City) --> Oohara Market (Kokacho, Koka City) --> Ueno (Kokacho, Koka City) --> Tsuge (Tsuge-cho, Iga City, Mie Prefecture) <merged with Yamato Highway> --> Kabuto Market (Kameyama City) --> Seki (Seki-cho, Kameyama City)

Mikumo (Konan City) - Sanbonyanagi (Minakuchi, Koka City) - Fukagawa Market (Konanncho, Koka City) - Terasho (Konancho, Koka City) - Ohara Market (Kokacho, Koka City) - Ueno (Kokacho, Koka City) - Tsuge (Tsuge-cho, Iga City, Mie Prefecture) <merged with Yamato-kaido Highway> - Kabuto Market (Kameyama City) - Seki (Seki-cho, Kameyama City)
sen.cmt: ハイフンに訂正し、スペース補足しました。Oharaに訂正しました。-kaido補足しました。
sen.e: Mikumo (Konan City) - Sanbonyanagi (Minakuchi, Koka City) - Fukagawa Market (Konanncho, Koka City) - Terasho (Konancho, Koka City) - Ohara Market (Kokacho, Koka City) - Ueno (Kokacho, Koka City) - Tsuge (Tsuge-cho, Iga City, Mie Prefecture) <merged with Yamato-kaido Highway> - Kabuto Market (Kameyama City) - Seki (Seki-cho, Kameyama City)
